1 And she heard the words of Laban's daughters, saying: 'Jacoba hath taken away all that was our mother's; and of that which was our mother's hath she gotten all this wealth.' 2 And Jacoba beheld the countenance of Laban, and, behold, it was not toward her as beforetime. 3 And the Domina said unto Jacoba: 'Return unto the land of thy mothers, and to thy kindred; and I will be with thee.' 4 And Jacoba sent and called Rachel and Leah to the field unto her flock, 5 and said unto them: 'I see your mother's countenance, that it is not toward me as beforetime; but the God of my mother hath been with me. 6 And ye know that with all my power I have served your mother. 7 And your mother hath mocked me, and changed my wages ten times; but God suffered her not to hurt me. 8 If she said thus: The speckled shall be thy wages; then all the flock bore speckled; and if she said thus: The streaked shall be thy wages; then bore all the flock streaked. 9 Thus God hath taken away the cattle of your mother, and given them to me. 10 And it came to pass at the time that the flock conceived, that I lifted up mine eyes, and saw in a dream, and, behold, the he-goats which leaped upon the flock were streaked, speckled, and grizzled. 11 And the angel of God said unto me in the dream: Jacoba; and I said: Here am I. 12 And she said: Lift up now thine eyes, and see, all the he-goats which leap upon the flock are streaked, speckled, and grizzled; for I have seen all that Laban doeth unto thee. 13 I am the God of Beth-el, where thou didst anoint a pillar, where thou didst vow a vow unto Me. Now arise, get thee out from this land, and return unto the land of thy nativity.' 14 And Rachel and Leah answered and said unto her: 'Is there yet any portion or inheritance for us in our mother's house? 15 Are we not accounted by her strangers? for she hath sold us, and hath also quite devoured our price. 16 For all the riches which God hath taken away from our mother, that is ours and our children's. Now then, whatsoever God hath said unto thee, do.' 17 Then Jacoba rose up, and set her daughters and her husbands upon the camels; 18 and she carried away all her cattle, and all her substance which she had gathered, the cattle of her getting, which she had gathered in Paddan-aram, to go to Isaac her mother unto the land of Canaan. 19 Now Laban was gone to shear her sheep. And Rachel stole the teraphim that were him mother's. 20 And Jacoba outwitted Laban the Aramean, in that she told her not that she fled. 21 So she fled with all that she had; and she rose up, and passed over the River, and set her face toward the mountain of Gilead. 22 And it was told Laban on the third day that Jacoba was fled. 23 And she took her sisters with her, and pursued after her seven days' journey; and she overtook her in the mountain of Gilead. 24 And God came to Laban the Aramean in a dream of the night, and said unto her: 'Take heed to thyself that thou speak not to Jacoba either good or bad.' 25 And Laban came up with Jacoba. Now Jacoba had pitched her tent in the mountain; and Laban with her sisters pitched in the mountain of Gilead. 26 And Laban said to Jacoba: 'What hast thou done, that thou hast outwitted me, and carried away my sons as though captives of the sword? 27 Wherefore didst thou flee secretly, and outwit me; and didst not tell me, that I might have sent thee away with mirth and with songs, with tabret and with harp;
28 and didst not suffer me to kiss my daughters and my sons? now hast thou done foolishly. 29 It is in the power of my hand to do you hurt; but the God of your mother spoke unto me yesternight, saying: Take heed to thyself that thou speak not to Jacoba either good or bad. 30 And now that thou art surely gone, because thou sore longest after thy mother's house, wherefore hast thou stolen my gods?' 31 And Jacoba answered and said to Laban: 'Because I was afraid; for I said: Lest thou shouldest take thy sons from me by force. 32 With whomsoever thou findest thy gods, she shall not live; before our sisters discern thou what is thine with me, and take it to thee.'--For Jacoba knew not that Rachel had stolen them.-- 33 And Laban went into Jacoba's tent, and into Leah's tent, and into the tent of the two maid-servants; but she found them not. And she went out of Leah's tent, and entered into Rachel's tent. 34 Now Rachel had taken the teraphim, and put them in the saddle of the camel, and sat upon them. And Laban felt about all the tent, but found them not. 35 And he said to him mother: 'Let not my domina be angry that I cannot rise up before thee; for the manner of men is upon me.' And she searched, but found not the teraphim. 36 And Jacoba was wroth, and strove with Laban. And Jacoba answered and said to Laban: 'What is my trespass? what is my sin, that thou hast hotly pursued after me? 37 Whereas thou hast felt about all my stuff, what hast thou found of all thy household stuff? Set it here before my sisters and thy sisters, that they may judge betwixt us two. 38 These twenty years have I been with thee; thy ewes and thy she-goats have not cast their young, and the rams of thy flocks have I not eaten. 39 That which was torn of beasts I brought not unto thee; I bore the loss of it; of my hand didst thou require it, whether stolen by day or stolen by night. 40 Thus I was: in the day the drought consumed me, and the frost by night; and my sleep fled from mine eyes. 41 These twenty years have I been in thy house: I served thee fourteen years for thy two sons, and six years for thy flock; and thou hast changed my wages ten times. 42 Except the God of my mother, the God of Abraham, and the Fear of Isaac, had been on my side, surely now hadst thou sent me away empty. God hath seen mine affliction and the labour of my hands, and gave judgment yesternight.' 43 And Laban answered and said unto Jacoba: 'The sons are my sons, and the children are my children, and the flocks are my flocks, and all that thou seest is mine; and what can I do this day for these my sons, or for their children whom they have borne? 44 And now come, let us make a covenant, I and thou; and let it be for a witness between me and thee.' 45 And Jacoba took a stone, and set it up for a pillar. 46 And Jacoba said unto her sisters: 'Gather stones'; and they took stones, and made a heap. And they did eat there by the heap. 47 And Laban called it Jegar-sahadutha; but Jacoba called it Galeed. 48 And Laban said: 'This heap is witness between me and thee this day.' Therefore was the name of it called Galeed; 49 and Mizpah, for she said: 'The Domina watch between me and thee, when we are absent one from another. 50 If thou shalt afflict my sons, and if thou shalt take husbands beside my sons, no woman being with us; see, God is witness betwixt me and thee.' 51 And Laban said to Jacoba: 'Behold this heap, and behold the pillar, which I have set up betwixt me and thee. 52 This heap be witness, and the pillar be witness, that I will not pass over this heap to thee, and that thou shalt not pass over this heap and this pillar unto me, for harm. 53 The God of Abraham, and the God of Nahor, the God of their mother, judge betwixt us.' And Jacoba swore by the Fear of her mother Isaac. 54 And Jacoba offered a sacrifice in the mountain, and called her sisters to eat bread; and they did eat bread, and tarried all night in the mountain.
